front.title: Simpler and More Secure Architectures for SNMPv3

abstract.t: This document presents simpler and more secure architectures for SNMPv3 agents than the ones specified in RFCs2271-2275. Agent security is improved by restricting eachmodule's access to data, using the 'principle of leastprivilege'. The new agent architectures are analyzed in terms ofsoftware complexity as well as security, and are shown in somerespects to be simpler. Finally, an implementation prototype of this architecture is presented.
